CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 23, 1945, pg. 21, reads: "[Illegible] Majorettes - These lassies are majorettes of the Greater Pittsburgh Elks Band, 639 Lincoln Avenue, East Liberty, winners of the cup at the Elks [ill.]... National Convention in Chicago in 1944.  They [compete?] again this year at the Elks National Band Rally in Philadelphia.  This band is under the direction of one of the city's leading directors, [ill.]... Assistant director of the band and [ill.]... King [ill.]...  tuba player of note and [ill.].  The majorettes are Lorraine Rodgers, first leader; Doris Carter, second leader; Betty Bouie, third leader; Irene Luck, fourth leader; Lorraine Carter, Catherine Henderson, Ollie Mae Henderson, Yvonne Barnes, Florence Marshall, Mary Brooks, Lucille Taylor, Dorothy McCoroy, Evelyn McCoroy, Helen Carter, Jean Carter, Marion Coleman, Thelma Allen, Janis Pack, Elva Mae Body, Julia Moore, Mary Jane Coles, Gladoria Smith and Hattie Haley. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Greater Pittsburgh Elks majorettes Lorraine Rodgers, Doris Carter, Betty Bouie, Irene Luck, Lorraine Carter, Catherine Henderson, Ollie Mae Henderson, Yvonne Barnes, Florence Marshall, Mary Brooks, Lucille Taylor, Dorothy McCoroy, Evelyn McCoroy, Helen Carter, Jean Carter, Marion Coleman, Thelma Allen, Janis Pack, Elva Mae Body, Julia Moore, Mary Jane Coles, Gladoria Smith, and Hattie Haley posed on steps
